children.value: OpenSumi framework aims to solve the redundant building problem of IDE product development within Alibaba, endeavours to fulfill IDE customization capabilities in more vertical scenarios and implement the shared underlying layer of Web and local clients, so that IDE development can move from the early "slash-and-burn" era to the "machine-based mass production" era.
If you are interested in building OpenSumi's framework, welcome to view
and help build the OpenSumi framework.
To ensure that the framework can run in both
environments, OpenSumi uses a set of project structure that separate the frontend and backend, call each other by a layer of abstract communication.
Each communicating connection corresponds to a separate
container on the front and back ends, so
and different connections are strictly isolated from each other.
There are three core processes within OpenSumi:
To ensure that extension problems do not affect IDE performance, OpenSumi uses a similar solution in terms of extension capabilities: similar to
, the extension is enabled by a separate extension process, and the extension process communicates with the frontend process by the backend process.
The different capability implementations of OpenSumi are split into different modules. The modules have a weak dependency on each other by using
. Some core basic modules, such as theme service and layout service, are also directly dependent by other modules.
Therefore, it is necessary to ensure the introduction sequence of some modules during the integration development process.
The overall start-up life cycle is shown in the following diagram.
A module refers to a package in the
and referenced by installing dependencies at integration time.
Typically, a module is a standalone feature implementation, for example, the
module implements a layer of generic debugging adapters based on
, core features including debugger front-end and session management. It is provided to extensions to call by means of extension APIs.
The following is the basic structure of a module.
, you can automatically create and associate references by using
layer code is generally used to handle view-related capabilities. Taking
module in OpenSumi as an example, the search interface is implemented by the
layer code is generally used to handle the logic that uses
capabilities, for example, the global search capability in the search panel is implemented by the
layer is generally used to store some public variables, tool methods, type declarations and so on.

Extension, is a type of program files supported by OpenSumi framework. By installing extension files on a specific location, the interface and functions of IDE can be re-developed. It is designed to be compatible with the
, that is, IDE products developed by OpenSumi are naturally compatible with
Due to protocol issues, OpenSumi cannot directly use the VS Code extension market source. By default OpenSumi currently integrates with
service developed by Eclipse company. Developers can use directly the service or build their own extension Marketplace based on
. Later on, we will also build our own extension marketplace to develop free extension hosting services for more developers.
